result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph B. Ellefsen

records.addlTxt:
Court in session at 311 pm. Appearances made. ADA Berg appears for the Sate of Wisconsin. Atty Mackenzie Renner appears with in custody defendant.  Matter is set for trial next week. Parties have come to an agreement. State is incompliance with chapter 950. Parties are in agreement. Defense acknowledges prior offenses. Court conducts plea colloquy. Court gives WARNINGS regarding deportation, felon prohibited from firearm possession pursuant to Sec. 941.29, ineligibility to vote until civil rights restored, prohibition of child offender working with children pursuant to Sec. 948.13 and possession of body armor prohibited pursuant to Sec. 941.291. 
Guilty plea entered on count #1 on 22CT1, 22CF2 and 21CF437. Remaining counts and cases dismissed and read in.
Plea made freely and voluntarily. Court adjudges defendant guilty. Factual basis found. Defendant does not make statement to court. 
323 pm Court in recess
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

BOND TO COVER 22GF385, 20CF590, 21CF437, 22CF2, & 22CT1

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): SCH. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-1771

Defendant Joseph B Ellefsen in court, in custody by video. Attorney Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Defendant qualifies for SPD. New total bond set. Attorney Renner provided Risk Assessment and Notice of Arrest. No victim in court.  Attorney Renner will represent defendant on this case. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Cash bond filed with the court. Defendant refused to sign.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): SCH. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
